seed.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a small hard object produced by plants, from which a new plant of the same kind grows
seed.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Sow the seeds one inch deep in the soil.
We grew all our tomatoes from seed.
seed.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Some of the poorest farmers don’t have enough money to buy seed.
seed.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: one of the small hard objects in a fruit such as an apple or orange, from which new fruit trees grow
seed.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: semen or sperm – often used humorously
seed.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: the group of people who have a particular person as their father, grandfather etc, especially when they form a particular race
seed.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: Sow the seeds in trays or pots.
You can grow most vegetables from seed.
The seeds should start to germinate after a few days.
I bought a packet of poppy seeds.
You can sprinkle grass seed over any gaps in the lawn.
seed.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to remove seeds from fruit or vegetables
seed.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Add one lime, seeded and sliced.
seed.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to give a player or team in a competition a particular position, according to how likely they are to win
seed.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: Sharapova was seeded fifth at Wimbledon.
seed.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: to plant seeds in the ground
seed.translation[1].note_box[0].items[0]: Seed is usually passive when used as a transitive verb
seed.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: money used to start a new company, project, activity etc
seed.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: Careful budgeting allows managers to accumulate savings, which they can use as seed capital.
Our total computer-relatedseed investment amounted to $29.1 million.
seed.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: to provide the money needed to start a company
seed.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: In Germany, government funding has helped seed about 300 companies in three years.
